intro: Timonius tambuyukonensis, commonly known as the Tambuyukon endemic, is a unique flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in the understory of tropical forests. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
